summary: Hanna-Barbera was an American animation studio started in 1957 by William Hanna and Joseph Barbera, known for creating "Tom and Jerry." They made many popular cartoons like "The Flintstones," "Scooby-Doo," and "The Smurfs." The company was very successful, even more so than Disney, with its characters appearing everywhere. In the 1980s, their popularity decreased, and the studio was bought by different companies over time. Eventually, in 2001, it became part of Warner Bros. Animation.
title: Hanna-Barbera
